content:
from all my tests:

because yahoo no longer requires a username at signup, us cox users didnt get a username for our accounts.

because thunderbird requires a username in order to complete the config, we cant use the program for our cox email (we could before because cox requires a username for their site)

i was using yahoo messenger basically since it started and still have access to my original account.

i have just successfully setup thunderbird to use that email, because that account still has a username.

overall: thunderbird needs to allow for email addresses in the username slot, so that us cox users can use it for our emails, otherwise we wont be able to.

content: Thunderbird provides you the ability to not update. That is your responsibility to do that. That lets you continue happily with whatever version you like. There are many happy users with version 91 and earlier, so it is certainly possible. Asking that enhancements not be done because you don't need them doesn't make for a good strategy. Software is complex, and there are always going to be bugs. If you feel that future updates are out of the question, the simple strategy is to make backup of your profile periodically. Then, if for whatever reason there is an update you don't like, just restore the backup profile and reinstall your preferred version over the installed version.
creator: davidsk

content: installing thunderbird is normally safe from affecting the installed profile. HOWEVER, if you are planning to reinstall, I always suggest taking the extra precaution of making a full copy of the profile. That is done in two steps: - be sure that thunderbird is not running - copy the profile, normally at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to somewhere else then, if the profile is affected in the fresh install, just - exit thunderbird - copy the saved thunderbird folder back to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming
creator: davidsk

content: Binnen POP kan er geen sprake zijn van downloaden van (extra) mappen, alleen het (opnieuw) downloaden van berichten in Postvak IN. Verzonden berichten die bijvoorbeeld te zien zijn via webmail, worden niet gedownload/gesynchroniseerd. Hiervoor heeft u toch echt IMAP nodig. Het is ook geen probleem om naast de POP-account een IMAP-account in te stellen met hetzelfde e-mailadres. Dit om te testen of IMAP wel of niet voldoet aan uw wensen.

content:
2 opties:

  • POP gebruiken en 'wachten' tot de gewenste mappen verschijnen; let wel op de instelling dat berichten van de server worden verwijderd als ze zijn gedownload;
  • IMAP gebruiken en de berichten (automatisch) verplaatsen naar de map 'Lokale mappen', eventueel met daarin door uzelf aangemaakte submappen; de berichten zullen na verplaatsen van de server worden verwijderd.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

creator: ikke1885

content: Het klinkt alsof u op de mailserver, naast de standaard mappen als 'Sent' en 'Draft', nog meer mappen in gebruik hebt en dat u die extra mappen en de inhoud daarvan naar uw PC wilt downloaden. Dat gaat met POP sowieso niet lukken, die haalt alleen de nieuwe berichten van Postvak IN op. Indien u lokaal dezelfde mappen wilt hebben als die u op de mailserver hebt, zult u IMAP moeten gebruiken om die mappen te synchroniseren, eventueel met de tips van hierboven. Vindt u dat u dan nog steeds POP moet gebruiken, dan kunt u naast de IMAP-account een POP-account aanmaken en de gesynchroniseerde mappen verplaatsen, of beter, kopiëren van IMAP naar POP.

  • IMAP gebruiken en de berichten (automatisch) verplaatsen naar de map 'Lokale mappen', eventueel met daarin door uzelf aangemaakte submappen; de berichten zullen na verplaatsen van de server worden verwijderd.

content:
This is the official (to my knowledge) documentation. Well worth the read https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird

Here is my own documentation on threading, duplicating the above, but it may help: You need to highlight each folder and click View>sort by>unthreaded. If this applies to just a few folders, just repeat the process as necessary. If you have many folders or plan to add many new folders, you may wish a different approach, below: 

More info:  To change default for *new* folders, In config editor, you can change default that applies to NEW folders you set up: mailnews.default_view_flags      0 =unthreaded    Config editor is available at Tools>settings>general and scroll to bottom right.    ------------ 	 To set many *existing* folders, follow these steps: This must be done on an account by account basis. - select table view  - the icon just to right of 'quick filter' button above message list pane - select a message folder and apply all desired attributes - View>sort by from menu bar (if not shown, click alt key) - click the icon at right side of column display in message list pane - select the entry near bottom 'Apply current view to...' - highlight 'folder and children' - move mouse left to see account name and move left again to display all account folders. Now CLICK. - a small menu will appear to confirm setting all folders within that account.  I did a simple (okay, crude) video at https://davidkirk.org/SettingDefaultFolderView.mp4   ALSO, for future installations of Thunderbird,  - create a simple text file with name of user.js with these lines:       // Set default threading to UNthreaded  ###   <== this line is optional, just for documentation      user_pref("mailnews.default_view_flags", 0); - install Thunderbird and exit prior to setting up accounts	  - copy the user.js file into the profile - now, when you start Thunderbird, unthreading will be the default. Problem solved.
creator: davidsk

content: Select the messages, right-click, Forward As Attachments, will open a new message with the selected messages attached as eml files, which can be opened by any mail app. Check the total size to conform to your mail providers message size limit. Message size is about 1/3 more than the total size of the attachments.
creator: sfhowes
